This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BES-MIRE.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T20:26:18Z Oliver Hooker 2015-03-11T20:25:46+00:00 2015-03-11T20:25:46+00:00 Advancing in 'R' statistics course https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;e83bec1a.1503 A repeat of the course titled 'ADVANCING IN R' has been scheduled for 30th November \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th December 2015<br><br>This course will provide an introduction to model selection and simplification, mixed effects models, generalised linear models and non-linear models<br><br>The content is designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling whilst providing an overview of the most frequently used approaches to analysing data. [...] Sarah Edwards 2015-02-25T13:19:53+00:00 2015-02-25T13:19:53+00:00 People, politics and the planet - Any Questions? Event https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;e8d8bddb.1502 Information on an upcoming event which may be of interest.<br><br>The BES is organising an exciting, high profile event in advance of the General Election \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an opportunity for members of the Society and the public to question spokespeople from the UK’s major political parties on the environmental commitments in their manifestos. [...] Soledad De Esteban Trivigno 2015-02-16T09:21:21+01:00 2015-02-16T09:21:21+01:00 Workshop on Agent-Based Models in Ecology, June 15-19, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;f01a00ba.1502 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "INTRODUCTION TO INDIVIDUAL BASED<br>MODELS IN ECOLOGY USING NETLOGO", June 15-19, 2015.<br><br>Instructors: Dr. J\ufffd\ufffdrgen Groeneveld (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental<br>Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany) and Dr. Alexander Singer (Helmholtz Centre for<br>Environmental Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany).<br><br>Site: Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona, Spain.<br><br>Agent-Based Models (ABM), or Individual Based Models, are one of a class of<br>computational models for simulating the actions and interactions of<br>autonomous agents (both individual or collective entities such as<br>organizations or groups) with a view to assessing their effects on the<br>system as a whole. In this [...] Thompson, Chris 2015-01-20T15:51:23+00:00 2015-01-20T15:51:23+00:00 Latest Oxford short-courses in Data Analysis in Ecology, Ecological Survey Techniques and Woodland Ecology and Management https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;ccc8c411.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*with apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Ecological Survey Techniques and Data Analysis in Ecology<br><br>Registration is open for online short-courses from the University of Oxford postgraduate part-time Ecological Survey Techniques Programme this February. I would be grateful if colleagues would circulate this information to graduate and doctoral students and associates for whom it will be of interest. The course is aimed at PhD students and post docs (although people at any stage of their career are welcome) with basic to moderate knowledge in R. [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-12-03T15:36:12+00:00 2014-12-03T15:36:12+00:00 Final Call: Field Techniques for Surveying Mammals and Reptiles https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;631585d6.1412 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting.*<br><br>This is the final call for the online short-course Field Techniques for Surveying Mammals and Reptiles due to commence Wednesday 07 January 2015. We would be grateful if you could forward this message on to colleagues, students and associates for whom it will be of interest. [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-10-14T11:29:27+00:00 2014-10-14T11:29:27+00:00 Final Places: NERC Funded Training Workshops in Environmental Sciences at the University of Oxford https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;aa567f4c.1410 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting.*<br><br>The last remaining places are available for two NERC-funded advanced training courses delivered at the University of Oxford. I would be grateful if colleagues would circulate this information to doctoral students and colleagues to whom it will be of interest.<br><br>Attendance at each workshop is offered to eligible delegates at no cost, including full-board and accommodation in Oxford. A limited travel allowance within the UK is also available. [...] Oliver Hooker 2014-10-07T19:27:40+01:00 2014-10-07T19:27:40+01:00 Advancing in 'R' statistics course https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;651032b2.1410 There are still a handful of places left for the 'advancing in R' statistics course being held in December at SCENE (the Scottish Center for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAdvancing in R\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling. It will cover model selection and simplification methods, likelihood ratio tests, mixed effect models, Generalised Linear Models (GLM\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds) (binomial and count data), nonlinear models (polynomial & mechanistic models) and how to combine these methods (e.g., nonlinear mixed effect (NLME) models & generalised linear mixed effect (GLMM) models) [...] Oliver Hooker 2014-09-25T17:54:13+01:00 2014-09-25T17:54:13+01:00 'Spatial analysis of ecological data using R' STATISTICS COURSE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;e68a9c02.1409 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSpatial analysis of ecological data with R\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (NEW STATISTICS COURSE)<br><br>This course will cover the concepts and R tools that can be used to analyse spatial data in ecology covering elementary and advanced spatial analysis techniques applicable to both plants and animals.<br><br>The course will consist of a series of modules (listed below), [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-09-02T14:59:17+00:00 2014-09-02T14:59:17+00:00 Applications Open: Data Analysis in Ecology https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;8a90f28a.1409 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>The Oxford postgraduate online training course Data Analysis in Ecology: Statistics for Field Biologists and Ecologists<http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk/dataanalysis> is open for registration to commence 29 October 2014. I would be grateful if you would circulate this information to students and colleagues for whom it will be of interest. [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-08-20T14:01:23+00:00 2014-08-20T14:01:23+00:00 Final call: Field Techniques for Surveying Invertebrates https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;9b33e349.1408 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>The final deadline is approaching for the Oxford online postgraduate training course Field Techniques for Surveying Vegetation<http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk/vegetation>, to commence 17 September 2014. I would be grateful if you would circulate this information to students, colleagues and volunteers for whom it will be of interest.<br><br>The course will prepare students for work in the field, firstly by giving them an understanding of the use life-form, structural-physiognomic, and habitat classifications for surveying vegetation. This will then be followed by insights into the process of plant species identification and the usefulness of structural methods for both vegetation [...] Mike Whitfield 2014-08-11T15:38:35+01:00 2014-08-11T15:38:35+01:00 Meeting: 'Carbon Cycling: from Plants to Ecosystems', Manchester University, 16-17th October https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;51a66fd9.1408 Dear all,<br><br>British Ecological Society special interest groups, Plants-Soils-Ecosystems<br>and Plant Environmental Physiology, are holding a joint meeting entitled<br>'Carbon Cycling: from Plants to Ecosystems' at the University of<br>Manchester, on 16-17th October 2014. The meeting aims to encompass a<br>variety of terrestrial carbon cycling research conducted at scales ranging<br>from the microbial to the landscape. *Abstract submission closes on Friday<br>22nd August.* For more details, please see:<br>http://besplantsoileco.wordpress.com/pse-pepg-joint-meeting/. Apologies if<br>you've seen this message already via different lists. [...] Oliver Hooker 2014-08-07T15:51:23+01:00 2014-08-07T15:51:23+01:00 Advancing in R statistics course https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;463d7337.1408 An \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdadvancing in R statistics\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd course based around biological data sets is being delivered by Luc Bussi\ufffd\ufffdre from Stirling University at the Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment (SCENE) from December 1st -5th 2014. The course has an introductory component which will then lead in to modules on model selection and simplification, mixed effects models, generalised linear models (with mixed effects) and nonlinear models (with mixed effects). For more details on the course please visit www.prstatistics.co.uk or email oliverhooker@prstatistics.co.uk. conference@nrgbess.net 2014-07-24T17:58:27+01:00 2014-07-24T17:58:27+01:00 Final reminder - Approaching deadlines for NRG BESS Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;38e7c7db.1407 Dear all,<br><br>This is a final reminder - Please circulate amongst your postgraduate and<br>postdoctoral researchers.<br><br>We remind you of the following approaching deadlines for the NRG BESS Early<br>Career Researcher Conference on Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and<br>Sustainability:<br><br>Final deadline for abstract submission: August 1st \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd no abstracts will be<br>accepted beyond this date!<br><br>Final registration deadline: August 15th - interest has been high and spaces are<br>limited, so please register as soon as possible [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-07-22T13:47:11+00:00 2014-07-22T13:47:11+00:00 New NERC Funded Training Workshops in Environmental Sciences at the University of Oxford https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;aa8000e7.1407 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Last year information was circulated regarding skills training workshops funded by the Natural Environment Research Council at the University of Oxford.<br><br>We are pleased to announce that following the success of the programme, the University has been awarded further funding to continue to deliver and build upon skills training at doctoral level in the environmental sciences and management. I would be grateful if you would circulate this information to doctoral students and colleagues for whom it will be of interest - please bear in mind that these workshops were very popular last year and spaces are likely to [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-07-03T14:09:49+00:00 2014-07-03T14:09:49+00:00 Final Call: Oxford PGCert in Ecological Survey Techniques https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;cd4488d8.1407 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting.*<br><br>This is the final call for applications for the part-time University of Oxford PGCert in Ecological Survey Techniques to commence September 2014.<br><br>The final application deadline is 23 July 2014.<br><br>This course is taught online with a face-to-face week in Oxford during September and experiential field project, including fieldwork, undertaken in the spring and summer. [...] conference@nrgbess.net 2014-06-30T16:18:02+01:00 2014-06-30T16:18:02+01:00 Approaching deadlines - ECR Conference on Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and Sustainability https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;8976ac5c.1406 Dear all,<br><br>Please circulate this email amongst your postgraduate and postdoctoral<br>researchers.<br><br>We remind you of the following approaching deadlines for the NRG BESS Early<br>Career Researcher Conference on Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and<br>Sustainability:<br><br>Early bird registration and first round abstract submission: July 15th<br><br>Applications for financial assistance (for self-funded students): July 15th<br><br>Final deadline for abstract submission: August 1st \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd no abstracts will be<br>accepted beyond this date! [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-06-03T11:16:32+00:00 2014-06-03T11:16:32+00:00 Final Call: Training Workshop in Grassland Ecology and Managment https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;818bbcde.1406 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>*With apologies for cross-posting.*<br><br>Last spaces are available for the University of Oxford one-day training workshop Grassland Ecology and Management<http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk/gem> on 21 June 2014.<br><br>This workshop will give participants the opportunity to learn the ecology of key grass types in the UK with Dr Kerry Lock, Former Reserve Manager, at the lowland grassland reserve Chimney Meadows in Oxfordshire. [...] conference@nrgbess.net 2014-05-16T08:24:51+01:00 2014-05-16T08:24:51+01:00 Early Career Researcher Conference - Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and Sustainability https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-MIRE;f7dc95b3.1405 Please find below an invitation to the NRG BESS Early Career Researcher<br>Conference on Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and Sustainability. We kindly ask<br>you to circulate this email amongst the postgraduate and postdoctoral<br>researchers, research technicians and research assistants in your<br>School/Research Group.<br><br>NRG BESS Early Career Researcher Conference 2014<br><br>on<br><br>Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and Sustainability<br><br>The NRG BESS Conference 2014 on Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and<br>Sustainability will take place at the University of Southampton on the 8th and<br>9th of September 2014. This conference is open to all postgraduate students,<br>postdoctoral researchers, research assistants and research technicians and to<br>both [...]
